definition: Cai Xiang (1012-1067), Song calligrapher
surname Cai
surname Xiang
to help/to assist/mutual assistance/to rush into or up/to raise or hold up/high/tall/old variant of 欀/chariot horse (old)/change (old)

sentences.english: The first part mainly introduces Cai Xiang's life experiences and excursion.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分介紹蔡襄的生平與交遊。

sentences.english: This is a letter written to Chen Maotsai by Tsai Chsiang.
sentences.chinese: 這是蔡襄給友人陳茂才的信件。

sentences.english: The second part are chiefly concerning about the main content of Cai Xiang's poetry.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分分析蔡襄詩歌的主要內容。

definition: Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher
four famous Song calligraphers, namely: Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4], Huang Tingjian 黃庭堅|黄庭坚[Huang2 Ting2 jian1], Mi Fu 米芾[Mi3 Fu2] and Cai Xiang 蔡襄[Cai4 Xiang1]
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Su Dongpo, another name for Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼 (1037-1101), northern Song writer and calligrapher
Zeng Gong (1019-1083), Song dynasty writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子, Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism
Wen Zhengming (1470-1559), Ming painter, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
Liu Gongquan (778-865), Tang calligrapher
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Zhu Yunming (1460-1526), Ming dynasty calligrapher
Wen Zhengming (1470-1559), Ming painter, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
Xu Xuan (-991), author of commentaries on Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字註|说文解字注[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4 Zhu4]
